title: (x) Sans serif, very en vogue right now - H&FJ Gotham {Sebastian}
content:
Trying to ID this font, looks like “Interstate black” and “Maquette” had a baby....

I’ve seen it around before I think most notably on a History Channel or National Geographic campaign in the NYC subways over the summer. Anyway the sample is here....

[http://www.plu.edu/~trullcw/img/newtype.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20081203180336/http:/www.plu.edu/~trullcw/img/newtype.jpg)

It’s the “GUYVER” text in the foreground.

Here’s another with some lowercase characters...  
 [http://www.scifijapan.com/news%20bites/NTUSA04a.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20081203180336/http:/www.scifijapan.com/news%20bites/NTUSA04a.jpg)

It’s “Le Chevalier D’ Eon” in the foreground.

I’m probably just blanking out, I have a few so similar. Any help would be appreciated.-C.

 [‹ (x) Looking for packaging icons - FF Cartonnage, FF Care Pack {Chris Keegan, Stephen}](http://web.archive.org/web/20081203180336/http:/www.typophile.com/node/38392 "Go to previous forum topic") [(x) BBC TopGear UK display typeface - Magistral {Geoff, Angel} ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20081203180336/http:/www.typophile.com/node/38387 "Go to next forum topic")
author: chrisdigital

comments.content: Another sighting of Gotham by Hoefler Frere-Jones.
Wow, thank you- was completely under my radar and I love their other fonts. I haven’t been on their site in quite a while. Thanks-C.
